content:
Great idea! Here's a proposal for an online digital product design clinic for beginners:

Overview:
The online digital product design clinic is designed to provide beginner learners with practical, hands-on experience in digital product design. The clinic will simulate real-world projects to enable students to learn by doing. Students will work in teams to design digital products for clients with specific needs, goals, and requirements.

Structure:
The clinic will be structured into three phases: research, design, and testing. Each phase will last four weeks and will culminate in a deliverable that demonstrates the student's understanding and application of the beginner curriculum. At the end of the clinic, students will have completed a portfolio-worthy digital product design project.

Phase 1: Research (4 weeks)

* Students will be divided into teams and assigned a client with specific needs and requirements.
* Students will conduct user research to gain a deep understanding of the target audience, market trends, and user needs.
* Students will create user personas, user journey maps, and conduct a competitive analysis.
* Students will present their research findings to the client and receive feedback.

Phase 2: Design (4 weeks)

* Students will use their research findings to ideate, sketch, and create wireframes for their digital product design.
* Students will create user flows, sitemaps, and design mockups.
* Students will present their design solutions to the client and receive feedback.
* Students will iterate on their design solutions based on client feedback.

Phase 3: Testing (4 weeks)

* Students will conduct usability testing to validate their design solutions.
* Students will create high-fidelity prototypes and conduct user testing.
* Students will refine their design solutions based on user testing feedback.
* Students will present their final design solutions to the client.

Delivery:
The online digital product design clinic will be delivered through a learning management system (LMS) that includes instructional videos, readings, assignments, and quizzes. Each phase will include weekly team meetings with a mentor who will provide guidance, support, and feedback on students' work. The final deliverable will be a portfolio-worthy digital product design project that students can use to showcase their skills and experience.

Benefits:
The online digital product design clinic offers a collaborative and practical learning environment that enables students to apply their beginner curriculum knowledge to real-world projects. By working on a project with a client, students will learn how to communicate with clients, manage project timelines, and work in a team. Additionally, students will have a portfolio-worthy project to showcase their skills to potential employers.
